title: Artinian Meadows
abstract:
We introduce the notion of Artinian meadow as an algebraic structure
constructed from an Artinian ring which is also a common meadow, i.e.\ a
commutative and associative structure with two operations (addition and
multiplication) with additive and multiplicative identities and for which
inverses are total. The inverse of zero in a common meadow is an error term
$\mathbb{a}$ which is absorbent for addition. We show that, in analogy with
what happens with commutative unital Artinian rings, Artinian meadows decompose
as a product of local meadows in an essentially unique way. We also provide a
canonical way to construct meadows from unital commutative rings.
